definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: It felt like falling headfirst off the top of a 2, 000-foot-tall building.
sentences.chinese: 我的感觉就像是头朝下跳下了两千英尺高的楼。

sentences.english: He lost his balance, and pitched out of the window headfirst.
sentences.chinese: 他失去平衡，头朝下从窗子上跌了下去。

sentences.english: The magician turned the glass up side down to show that itw as emp ty.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师把玻璃杯头朝下翻转让人看它是空的。

sentences.english: He finally pulled the baby all the way out and held it upside down and slapped its bottom to make it cry.
sentences.chinese: 医生最终把孩子整个提了出来，头朝下打屁股让他哭。

sentences.english: And then at the top suddenly flipped over and was hanging head down .
sentences.chinese: 在顶端时突然翻转过来，头朝下吊着。

sentences.english: Basically, the head-down, legs-in-the-air position has become standard in modern medicine mainly because it gives doctors direct and unrestricted access.
sentences.chinese: 基本上，头朝下腿伸在空中被认为是标准的姿势。

sentences.english: She felt as if she were falling headlong into a pit.
sentences.chinese: 她感到她似乎突然头朝下掉进坑里。

sentences.english: I threw the beautiful princess headfirst down the mountain to my acquaintances.
sentences.chinese: 我将公主头朝下扔给了山下的相识。

sentences.english: Video taken at the scene showed the plane heading nose-down into the ground.
sentences.chinese: 现场拍摄的录像显示，飞机头朝下撞向地面。

definition: to fall headlong/(fig.) to suffer an ignominious failure
to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
to kick one's legs/leg press (exercise)/(coll.) to kick the bucket
a handstand/to turn upside down/to stand on one's head/upside down
to hang in the air/suspended in midair/(fig.) uncertain
